keyPolicies.policyTitle: Preserving the Greenbelt and protecting the environment
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Oppose all housebuilding on the Greenbelt and support public investment in renewable energy.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Supporting new co-operatives and investing in infrastructure
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Create well-paid, skilled jobs by restarting our economy and reinvigorating green co-operative enterprises.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Creating a fairer workplace for all
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Uphold improved employment rights, and close discrimination against those with disabilities and LGBT status.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Cut inequality in income and wealth
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Implement a progressive tax system ensuring those with the broadest shoulders bear the greatest burden.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Action to secure real equality and social justice
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to bringing an end to prejudice for LGBT and disabled people and fighting all forms of discrimination.

issues.brexitEurope: A Brexit that defends our rights as workers and citizens.
issues.environment: Preserve the Greenbelt and protect the environment.
issues.health: Rescuing the NHS and Social Care. Fund NHS properly and end privatisation. Ensure dignity for older and disabled people.

community.content: Schools across Pudsey constituency are facing a financial crisis as the Tories slash real-term funding. St Mary’s in Menston is losing £517 per pupil. Every primary school will lose the equivalent of at least one teacher’s salary by 2020. I am committed to opposing these cuts.

leaflet.personalStatement: I've worked and lived in this constituency for many years with my wife, daughter and young sons. I understand the struggles facing local families.

politicalExperience.role: Manager for a major local employer

endorsements.endorser: Paul Truswell, Former Labour MP for Pudsey
endorsements.endorsement: With a Labour Government and MP, we won huge improvements for our area. I have faith in Ian as a deeply motivated campaigner and local family man.

quotes.text: With a Labour Government and MP, we won huge improvements for our area. I have faith in Ian as a deeply motivated campaigner and local family man. He’ll fight to protect our local services, and for a Brexit that defends our rights as workers and citizens. Tories offer only empty promises and more cuts. Don’t wreck our services and pursue a Brexit that will be bad for us all.

images.caption: Ian campaigning with local Labour activists

examples: Schools across Pudsey constituency are facing a financial crisis as the Tories slash real-term funding. St Mary’s in Menston is losing £517 per pupil. Every primary school will lose the equivalent of at least one teacher’s salary by 2020.
This election comes at a critical time for local people in Pudsey, Horsforth and Aireborough.
Our hospitals, social care and mental health services are creaking.
Our young people are struggling with increasing debt and housing costs.
I understand the struggles facing local families.
Schools across Pudsey constituency are facing a financial crisis as the Tories slash real-term funding.
Rescuing the NHS and Social Care.
A Brexit that defends our rights as workers and citizens.
Labour will fund our crumbling NHS properly and end privatisation.
